page: HS50030: General Equilibrium And Welfare Economics

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisites: HS20005/HS20001 Course ContentsGeneral Equilibrium and Efficiency- Partial Vs General Equilibrium Analysis, Equation of general equilibrium, Pitfalls in the determination of price level, Optimal cash balance, Resource allocation and general equilibrium, Pareto-optimality and efficiency, Marginal rules for Pareto-optimal output levels, An optimal price system, Externalities for production and consumption, Compensation criteria, Democratic group decisions, Activity analysis, integer programming and welfare economics, Dual prices and decentralized decision making
page: HS50030: General Equilibrium And Welfare Economics
